text: is a Japanese artificial satellite which was put into orbit in 2006. The launch was a project of the Institute of Space and Astronautical Science and the Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency (JAXA). The satellite was launched on February 22, 2006.JAXA, "Catalogue of ISAS Missions" ; retrieved 2012-8-13. The primary mission of Akari was as a space observatory to survey the entire sky in near-, mid- and far-infrared "JAXA Hopes To Keep Akari Going Despite Power Failure," Space News International. 27 May 2011; retrieved 2012-8-13. with its infrared telescope. == References == == Other websites == * Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency (JAXA), Akari (ASTRO-F) mission profile Category:Japanese satellites Category:2006 in Asia Category:2000s in Japan Category:Spacecrafts launched in 2000s
title: Akari (satellite)
